p: Saad et al. [ 54] attributed the decrease in B. tabaci oviposition to the volatile compounds found in citronella ( Cymbopogon nardus L.) essential oil, which may have affected the development of the female whitefly, reducing its reproductive capacity. An example of this activity was reported by Rao et al. [ 55], who found that Dysdercus koenigii nymphs treated with Artemisia annua essential oil showed ovarian development issues, decreasing the number of produced oocytes with a consequent influence on egg production.
